bug.short_desc: searching for a link using the ' shortcut finds links that are not visible on the page.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
for example it finds links that are hidden in java script menus. searching for "ranking" will display the behavior
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. press ' 2. type in ranking Actual Results: see links are found but nothing is highlighted, the problem being that the link isn't visible on the page but will show up if you expand the menus
Expected Results: only the visible links should be searchable

I can reproduce on Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:2.2a1pre) Gecko/20110404 Firefox/4.2a1pre ID:20110404030429 but I personally would consider this bug a feature.
I'll be using extensively for the time being and hope they don't fix it, is a big usability improvement ad you don't have to mouse on the menus but you still see where you're going on the "URL bubble" =)

with more research it seems all the browsers behave the same way. i think it would be really useful if there was some way of knowing that the link is not visible or something along those lines. so i guess this isn't a bug but a feature request.
